component.text: Performing proof-of-concept testing of a new design before deployment reduces risk and shortens implementation time.
Simulations and prototypes can be used to test complex network functionality without disrupting the existing network users.
Building a prototype network to perform proof-of-concept tests requires careful planning and organization.
Creating detailed test plans ensures that the testing is performed in an organized and efficient manner.

Upon successfully completing this chapter, you will be able to:
  • Describe the purpose of a proof-of-concept test.

  • Create test plans to perform simulated or prototype tests of the important design elements proposed for a network upgrade.

  • Perform proof-of-concept tests on the LAN design elements according to test plans.

  • Identify any risks and weaknesses in the design, based on the proof-of-concept test conclusions.
